intro: Monodora angolensis, commonly known as African breadnut, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces a hard, woody fruit that contains a single, large seed. It is often found in moist forested areas and is valued for its timber and medicinal properties. The species is also noted for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
